explanation:
1) toxdigitvalue — This function is the only direct callee of MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_. To determine whether the target function (or any code it invokes) violates the MISRA rule about using memcmp on null-terminated strings, the implementation (or macro definition) of toxdigitvalue must be inspected to see if it calls memcmp (or a wrapper) and how it uses memcmp arguments. Even if toxdigitvalue seems trivial, it could hide a memcmp call or expand to code that does so.

2) memcmp — The MISRA rule concerns the Standard Library function memcmp specifically. Including memcmp as a close symbol lets the analyzer detect any direct or indirect calls to memcmp from the target function or its callees and evaluate whether the arguments supplied are null-terminated strings (the prohibited usage).
